title: How to Make Homemade Chocolate
description:
Learn how to make homemade chocolate with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Homemade-Chocolate

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to make homemade milk chocolate first add 1 cup 125 grams of powdered sugar to a metal strainer over a bowl then add 3/4 of a cup 75 grams of cocoa powder and a third of a cup 40 grams of powdered milk shake the metal strainer to sift the ingredients into the bowl below then stir everything together now bring two to three inches five to seven and a half centimeters of water to a boil in a pot on the stove top place a heat-safe ball on top of the pot so it's not touching the water and add 3/4 of a cup a hundred and eighty millilitres of melted coconut oil gradually stir the dry mixture into the coconut oil until well combined pour the mixture into a silicone chocolate mold then put the chocolate in the fridge for two to three hours or until it's solid finally take the silicone mold out of the fridge pop out the chocolates and enjoy to make homemade dark chocolate first add 1/2 a cup a hundred and twenty milliliters of melted coconut oil to a heat-safe ball over a pot of boiling water then add three tablespoons 45 milliliters of honey and stir until the honey dissolves into the coconut oil now stir in one cup a hundred grams of cocoa powder remove the bowl from the heat and add half a teaspoon two and a half milliliters of vanilla extract transfer the chocolate mixture to a silicone mold refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours and enjoyto make homemade milk chocolate first add 1 cup 125 grams of powdered sugar to a metal strainer over a bowl then add 3/4 of a cup 75 grams of cocoa powder and a third of a cup 40 grams of powdered milk shake the metal strainer to sift the ingredients into the bowl below then stir everything together now bring two to three inches five to seven and a half centimeters of water to a boil in a pot on the stove top place a heat-safe ball on top of the pot so it's not touching the water and add 3/4 of a cup a hundred and eighty millilitres of melted coconut oil gradually stir the dry mixture into the coconut oil until well combined pour the mixture into a silicone chocolate mold then put the chocolate in the fridge for two to three hours or until it's solid finally take the silicone mold out of the fridge pop out the chocolates and enjoy to make homemade dark chocolate first add 1/2 a cup a hundred and twenty milliliters of melted coconut oil to a heat-safe ball over a pot of boiling water then add three tablespoons 45 milliliters of honey and stir until the honey dissolves into the coconut oil now stir in one cup a hundred grams of cocoa powder remove the bowl from the heat and add half a teaspoon two and a half milliliters of vanilla extract transfer the chocolate mixture to a silicone mold refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours and enjoy

title: How to Make Hot Chocolate Mix from Pure Cocoa
description:
This quick video will give you some tips on how to make hot chocolate mix from pure cocoa!

Read more: https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Hot-Chocolate-Mix-from-Pure-Cocoa

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/

title: How to Make Hot Cocoa
description:
Learn how to make hot cocoa with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Hot-Cocoa

0:00 Classic Hot Cocoa
1:00 Rich Hot Chocolate
1:55 Single-Serving Microwave Cocoa

Ingredients: 
Classic Hot Cocoa
4 cups (950 ml) of milk, half-and-half, or cream
1/2 cup (100 g) of granulated sugar
1/4 cup (25 g) of unsweetened cocoa powder
1 teaspoon (4.9 ml) of vanilla extract
Marshmallows for serving
Makes 4 cups (950 ml) of cocoa

Rich Hot Chocolate
2 cups (470 ml) of milk, half-and-half, or cream
2 pinches of salt
4 ounces (112 g) of bittersweet or semisweet (50 to 60% cocoa) chocolate
1⁄2 teaspoon (2.5 ml) of vanilla extract
2 tablespoons (14 g) of unsweetened cocoa powder, optional
Makes 2 cups (470 ml) of cocoa

Single-Serving Microwave Cocoa
2 tablespoons (14 g) of unsweetened cocoa powder
1 to 2 tablespoons (12.5 to 25 g) of sugar
1 pinch of salt
1 cup (240 ml) of milk, half-and-half, or cream
1⁄4 teaspoon (1.2 ml) of vanilla extract
Makes 1 cup (240 ml) of cocoa

description:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to make lemonade start by cutting some lemons in half and squeezing the juice into a glass or pitcher then add about three times as much cold water to the pitcher as there is lemon juice finally add a little bit of sugar and stir the lemonade thoroughly if the lemonade tastes too bitter add more sugar and if it tastes too sweet add more lemon juice you can also make sparkling lemonade by substituting the water with carbonated waterto make lemonade start by cutting some lemons in half and squeezing the juice into a glass or pitcher then add about three times as much cold water to the pitcher as there is lemon juice finally add a little bit of sugar and stir the lemonade thoroughly if the lemonade tastes too bitter add more sugar and if it tastes too sweet add more lemon juice you can also make sparkling lemonade by substituting the water with carbonated water

title: How to Make Muffins
description:
Learn How to Make Muffins with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Muffins

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to make muffins first pre-heat your oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit or 190 degrees Celsius and grease the wells of a muffin pan with cooking spray then add two and a half cups or 320 grams of all-purpose flour and 1/2 cup or 100 grams of sugar to a large bowl followed by 1 tablespoon or 14 grams of baking powder and 1/4 TSP or 1 and 1/4 grams of salt whisk the dry ingredients together and set aside next for one and a quarter cups or 300 milliliters of milk and 1/2 cup or 120 milliliters of vegetable oil into a medium bowl followed by one large egg and 1 TSP or 5 milliliters of vanilla extract whisk the wet ingredients together thoroughly then pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix everything together with a wooden spoon until the batter is just combined as you mix add one cup or 175 grams of your favorite mix in if you'd like like chocolate chips blueberries or walnuts finally divide the batter evenly between the muffin pan wells and bake the muffins for 20 minutes or until they're golden brown you'll know they're done when a toothpick inserted into the center comes out cleanto make muffins first pre-heat your oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit or 190 degrees Celsius and grease the wells of a muffin pan with cooking spray then add two and a half cups or 320 grams of all-purpose flour and 1/2 cup or 100 grams of sugar to a large bowl followed by 1 tablespoon or 14 grams of baking powder and 1/4 TSP or 1 and 1/4 grams of salt whisk the dry ingredients together and set aside next for one and a quarter cups or 300 milliliters of milk and 1/2 cup or 120 milliliters of vegetable oil into a medium bowl followed by one large egg and 1 TSP or 5 milliliters of vanilla extract whisk the wet ingredients together thoroughly then pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix everything together with a wooden spoon until the batter is just combined as you mix add one cup or 175 grams of your favorite mix in if you'd like like chocolate chips blueberries or walnuts finally divide the batter evenly between the muffin pan wells and bake the muffins for 20 minutes or until they're golden brown you'll know they're done when a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean

title: How to Make Muffins with Pancake Mix
description:
Learn how to make muffins with pancake mix with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Muffins-with-Pancake-Mix

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: if you want to make muffins with pancake mix preheat the oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit and spray a muffin pan with non-sticky spray you can also use muffin liners in the individual tins mix together two cups of pancake mix 2 3 cup of milk 2 eggs and a half cup of maple syrup in a large bowl then transfer the batter into the muffin pan filling each slot about 2 3 of the way full bake the muffins for 13 to 15 minutes and allow them to cool to room temperature before serving themif you want to make muffins with pancake mix preheat the oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit and spray a muffin pan with non-sticky spray you can also use muffin liners in the individual tins mix together two cups of pancake mix 2 3 cup of milk 2 eggs and a half cup of maple syrup in a large bowl then transfer the batter into the muffin pan filling each slot about 2 3 of the way full bake the muffins for 13 to 15 minutes and allow them to cool to room temperature before serving them if you want to make muffins with pancake mix preheat the oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit and spray a muffin pan with non-sticky spray you can also use muffin liners in the individual tins mix together two cups of pancake mix 2 3 cup of milk 2 eggs and a half cup of maple syrup in a large bowl then transfer the batter into the muffin pan filling each slot about 2 3 of the way full bake the muffins for 13 to 15 minutes and allow them to cool to room temperature before serving them

title: How to Care For Cast Iron
description:
Learn How to Care For Cast Iron with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Care-For-Cast-Iron

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to care for cast iron clean it as soon as possible after using it wipe it down with hot water and a cloth if there's still food stuck on it try scrubbing it off with some salt after you clean cast iron make sure you dry it completely so it doesn't get rusty if Russ does form scrub it off with white vinegar and a sponge in addition to cleaning you should re season cast iron after each use coat the cast iron with a layer of vegetable oil which will help prevent food from sticking to it the next time you use itto care for cast iron clean it as soon as possible after using it wipe it down with hot water and a cloth if there's still food stuck on it try scrubbing it off with some salt after you clean cast iron make sure you dry it completely so it doesn't get rusty if Russ does form scrub it off with white vinegar and a sponge in addition to cleaning you should re season cast iron after each use coat the cast iron with a layer of vegetable oil which will help prevent food from sticking to it the next time you use it

title: How to Make Red
description:
Learn how to make red with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Red

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to make red shades with paints or food coloring start by using pure red you won't be able to make red from other colors because it's a primary color that can't be produced by mixing shades if you want a cooler red try mixing red with a small amount of blue to produce a violet red color for a warm variation mix the pure red with yellow to create orange red for a burgundy color mix red with violet to make a red with strong brown undertones mix red with orange if you simply want a lighter shade stir in white or for a darker shade mix with blackto make red shades with paints or food coloring start by using pure red you won't be able to make red from other colors because it's a primary color that can't be produced by mixing shades if you want a cooler red try mixing red with a small amount of blue to produce a violet red color for a warm variation mix the pure red with yellow to create orange red for a burgundy color mix red with violet to make a red with strong brown undertones mix red with orange if you simply want a lighter shade stir in white or for a darker shade mix with black
